required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Post-anesthesia Management in Patients Undergoing Neurosurgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Cohort Study of Post-anesthesia Management in Patients Undergoing Neurosurgery

brief_summary.textblock: The postoperative complications of neurosurgery are various and complex, which brings heavy economic and social burden to families. Timely detection and early intervention can help reduce the incidence of adverse events and mortality. The main purpose of this study is to analyze the possible factors related to postoperative complications of Neurosurgery, so as to achieve the prospective prevention and treatment of postoperative complications of neurosurgery.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of postoperative complications in neurosurgery.
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of postoperative complications was diagnosed by the corresponding assessment scale.Complications include nausea, vomiting, delirium, delayed recovery, intracranial hematoma,etc.

study_pop.textblock: Patients expected to returned to post-anesthesia care unit(PACU) after neurosurgical treatment in Tiantan hospital from October 2019 to October 2022.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- From October 2019 to October 2022, all patients received neurosurgery in Tiantan hospital and expected to returned to PACU.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Preoperative severe cognitive dysfunction ；
- Tracheal intubation remained after operation ；
- Refused to sign informed consent.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anesthesiology, Beijing Tiantan Hospital
